Ohranjajmo zdravje
Za dvig imunskega sistema pogosteje posegajte po sadju in zelenjavi; v njih so antioksidanti, ki varujejo celice pred prostimi radikali.
01 Nov 2019, 15:06 by Aleksander Brudar



Če uživamo dovolj sadja in zelenjave, poskrbimo za zadosten vnos vitamina C.



Večkrat posezite po česnu. FOTOGRAFIJE: Guliver/Getty Images



Z rednim gibanjem in uravnoteženo prehrano boste največ naredili za svoje telo.


Da bi bili zdravi in čili, samo redna telesna aktivnost ne bo dovolj. Treba je namreč paziti tudi na to, kaj bomo vsak dan dali na krožnik. Prav nič ne boste zgrešili, če boste v prehrano pogosteje dodajali z antioksidanti bogato sadje in zelenjavo: tako boste okrepili imunski sistem.


Če uživamo dovolj sadja in zelenjave, poskrbimo za zadosten vnos vitamina C.

Kot nam je pred časom razložila svetovalka za zdravo prehrano Marija Merljak, uni. dipl. inž. živ. tehn., so antioksidanti "snovi, ki sadju in zelenjavi dajejo intenzivne barve. Uvrščamo jih na v maščobah topne karotenoidne snovi in na vodotopne flavonoidne snovi."Priporočila je, da jemo veliko korenja, paprike, čilija, paradižnika, rdeče čebule, špinače, marelic, manga (vse to vsebuje karotenoidne snovi); v grozdju, jagodičevju, brusnicah, malinah in gozdnih sadežih pa tudi v vinu so flavonoidne snovi, za hitro okrepitev imunskega sistema so nujne križnice (brokoli, brstični ohrovt, zelje, repa, koleraba, redkev).


Z rednim gibanjem in uravnoteženo prehrano boste največ naredili za svoje telo.

Za lažje razumevanje vloge antioksidantov v našem telesu povejmo, da gre za snovi, ki izničijo oziroma nevtralizirajo za celice nevarne proste radikale. Ti nastanejo kot stranski produkti metabolizma kisika oziroma tako imenovanega celičnega dihanja in napadajo celice v našem telesu. To je lahko sčasoma eden od vzrokov za nastanek številnih bolezni, kot so denimo rakave tvorbe, infarkt, diabetes in vnetne bolezni.Četudi se proti tem naše telo v normalnih razmerah brani relativno dobro, pišejo na spletni strani nacionalnega portala o hrani in prehrani (prehrana.si), moramo vedeti, da povečano število prostih radikalov nastaja predvsem takrat, ko je naše telo pod stresom. In prav s prehrano mu lahko zelo pomagamo.
Najbolje je, da jemo sveže sadje in zelenjavo.
Kot antioksidanta v telesu delujejo vitamina C in E ter karoteni (oranžna rastlinska barva), ki jih naše telo samo spremeni v vitamin A. In še: nekatere intervencijske študije ter laboratorijske raziskave so pokazale, da redno uživanje rastlinskih antioksidantov zmanjšuje možnost za oksidativne poškodbe celic in s tem za nastanek nekaterih bolezni. 
Raje sadje kot prehranska dopolnila
Da bi s prehrano v telo vnesli čim več antioksidantov, velja poudariti, da morata biti sadje in zelenjava sveža ali globoko zamrznjena, saj se le tako ohranijo te zelo pomembne snovi. Če boste namreč posegali le po konzervirani, predelani ali kuhani zelenjavi ali sadju, si prav velike koristi glede antioksidantov ne morete obetati. Poleg naštetih živil je dobro poseči tudi po česnu, saj ta, kažejo raziskave, vsebuje največ antioksidantov. Ti so sicer tudi v morski hrani (sardele, skuše) in hrani živalskega izvora.
Antioksidanti so snovi, ki dajo sadju in zelenjavi intenzivne barve.
Na nacionalnem portalu o hrani in prehrani še zapišejo, da zaenkrat še ni dovolj zanesljivih znanstvenih dokazov, da bi dodatno uživanje antioksidantov pozitivno vplivalo na naše zdravje oziroma prispevalo k preprečevanju nekaterih bolezni. "S pogostim uživanjem sadja in zelenjave bomo v telo poleg ostalih koristnih snovi vnesli tudi zajetno količino antioksidantov, zato poseganje po prehranskih dopolnilih z visoko vsebnostjo antioksidantov ni smiselno in je lahko celo škodljivo. Visoki odmerki antioksidantov lahko namreč v telesu delujejo povsem nasprotno, kot smo si obetali, in sicer kot prooksidanti in tako celo pospešijo nastajanje oksidativnih poškodb," dodajo.

Let's keep healthy
To raise your immune system, reach out to fruits and vegetables more often; they contain antioxidants that protect cells from free radicals.
01 Nov 2019, 14:06 by Aleksander Brudar



If you consume enough fruits and vegetables, make sure you have sufficient vitamin C intake.



Repeat the garlic several times. PHOTOS: Gulliver / Getty Images



Regular exercise and a balanced diet will do the most for your body.


To be healthy and chili, regular physical activity alone will not be enough. We should also be careful about what we put on a plate every day. There is nothing wrong with adding more fruits and vegetables rich in antioxidants to your diet: it will strengthen your immune system.


If you consume enough fruits and vegetables, make sure you have sufficient vitamin C intake.

As a health nutrition consultant Marija Merljak, uni. dipl. and with. alive. tech., antioxidants are "substances that give intense color to fruits and vegetables. They are classified as fat soluble carotenoid substances and water soluble flavonoid substances." She recommended eating lots of carrots, peppers, chillies, tomatoes, red onions, spinach apricot, mango (all containing carotenoids); grapes, berries, cranberries, raspberries and forest fruits, as well as wine, are flavonoid substances, and crucifixes (broccoli, Brussels sprouts, cabbage, turnips, kohlrabi, radishes) are needed to quickly strengthen the immune system.


Regular exercise and a balanced diet will do the most for your body.

To help us understand the role of antioxidants in our bodies, let's say that these are substances that eliminate or neutralize the cells of dangerous free radicals. They are produced as by-products of the metabolism of oxygen, or so-called cellular respiration, and attack the cells in our body. This can, over time, be one of the causes of many diseases, such as cancers, heart attacks, diabetes and inflammatory diseases. Even though our body normally defends relatively well under normal conditions, the National Food and Nutrition Portal (Diet) writes .si), we need to know that the increased number of free radicals occurs mainly when our body is stressed. And with nutrition, we can greatly help him.
It is best to eat fresh fruits and vegetables.
Vitamin C and E and carotene (orange plant color) act as antioxidants in the body, which our body only turns into vitamin A. And further: some intervention studies and laboratory studies have shown that regular consumption of plant antioxidants reduces the chance of oxidative damage to cells and thus for the onset of some diseases.
I prefer fruits as nutritional supplements
In order to bring as much antioxidant into the body as possible, it should be emphasized that fruits and vegetables must be fresh or deep-frozen, in order to preserve these very important substances. If you only resort to canned, processed or cooked vegetables or fruits, you really cannot promise the great benefits of antioxidants. In addition to these foods, it is also good to go for garlic, as research shows that it contains the most antioxidants. They are also found in seafood (sardines, mackerel) and food of animal origin.
Antioxidants are substances that give fruits and vegetables intense color.
The National Food and Nutrition Portal says that there is not yet enough reliable scientific evidence that additional consumption of antioxidants would have a positive effect on our health or contribute to the prevention of certain diseases. "Frequent consumption of fruits and vegetables will introduce a significant amount of antioxidants into the body, among other nutrients, so resorting to high antioxidant dietary supplements may not be meaningful and may even be harmful. have promised themselves as prooxidants and even accelerate the generation of oxidative damage, "they added.
